data.title: Mile High Nachos!
data.text:
Fuzzy's is such a fun place!!  Small upstairs seating, cozy bar seating, 2 open room seating areas and patio umbrella tables accommodate all kinds of singles to parties who come to enjoy yummy Mexican food.  Music all around, they will call out your name on the loud speakers when your food is ready to pick up.  
Their salads are wonderful, margaritas and beeritas great and the Nachos are the best!  You get a platter piled high with layers of chips and 4 kinds of cheeses and your choice of meats - my favorite: shredded chicken!
  Anything with queso is a monterrey jack queso that is so light - and every dish had crumbled feta cheese topping to give it a different flavor.  Not a heavy or greasy cheddar taste like so many Mexican restaurants.  Rolls of paper towels on the table give you plenty of clean up after licking your fingers of tasty dripping queso!

data.title: Fun lunch
data.text: Staff is fun, helpful and makes dining as good as the food. They have some unique dishes and make it feel more like visiting a restaurant rather than a taco stand. Beverages are varied and served with a smile. Overall its good food and good prices and its a fun time.

data.title: Awesome Food and Experience
data.text: Me and my buddy wanted to try something new so we went in to Fuzzy Tacos for lunch.  It looked small and not what I expected from the outside but you go in and the building explodes with space and a awesome atmosphere.  We got 2 burritos and an order of nachos and only finished the nachos cause the food was gigantic.  They have awesome margaritas that had some of my favorite beer poured upside in the bottle in the margarita glasses.  There are TVs everywhere and a mini bar in the back.  I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a fun lunch or a chill spot to have some drinks.

data.title: Average Mexican
data.text:
While visiting Arvada, we stopped in Fuzzy's for lunch.  It was very busy, and very loud for a afternoon.  I like that they have that "mexican restaurant" feel going for them, lots of bright colors and decor.

You order at the counter and they call you when your food comes up- so you don't have a sit down dining experience. The place just didn't feel very clean... there was lots of napkins and food scraps on the floor... our table was sticky and we couldn't find someone to wipe it down.  It just had a weird vibe to the place, reminded me of a mall cafeteria type of food place- very un-personal because you just order, and they yell out your name to come claim your food when its up.

The food was average.  Nothing very special, but then again, not bad.  The place isn't going for a fancy 5 star place, so you get what you pay for.  The lady who did our ordering was friendly and helped me pick out special choices because I do not eat dairy- so this gives it a extra star because she was very friendly.

data.title: Fuzzy's is a friendly, happy and family place
data.text: Such a variety of mexican food to select from.  Love the atmosphere.  Drinks plenty. Great place to hang out during the summer evening.

data.title: A go-to place in Old Town Arvada
data.text: Arvada is a little out of the way for me, but whenever I go there or am "just passing through," I always look for an excuse to stop at Fuzzy's.  It's not necessarily the most authentic Mexican food around, but it's great fare for ordering and eating there or picking up to take out.  The portions are good, the prices are reasonable, there's a nice selection of margaritas and draft beer options and - last, but not least - outside seating available (weather permitting), right along Olde Wadsworth Blvd. It's a great, casual, family-friendly atmosphere - heck, I think I'll try to go there again this week!

data.title: A great place to hangout with friends or family
data.text: Food is pretty good, not amazing, but with the great margaritas they have they are  good together! Not a 5 star restaurant but it's good for what it is, a happy chill atmosphere. We go all the time!

data.title: Fun & grubby
data.text: Well loved and used taco shop, good food as expected. Nice margarita, sticky floors and tables, no TP in bathroom, facilities looking a little neglected. Time for a spiff up!

data.title: I love this taco place!
data.text: In the heart of old town Arvada this is a great restaurant. They have a huge menu to choose from that has food and alcohol. I went with my husband, daughter( less than 1) and we ate for less than $30 we got beer too.

data.title: Not worth the stop!
data.text: The tacos were average - the Pollock on the fish taco was excellent.  The restaurant was not clean enough for my standards, because of sauce on the seats, a stickiness on the table, and an unacceptable women's rest room, cleanliness-wise.  My order was not correct and the "expeditor" was rude when I told him I received something i did not order.  We son't be going there again.

data.title: Fun and TASTY
data.text: I really like this restaurant . It's a small chain that offers a more authentic and fun approach to Mexican food . I like the chipotle sauce and mole dishes.

data.title: Good tacos for what it is!
data.text: Ok admittedly, I'm a taco snob. This place has pretty good & inexpensive tacos! Yummy! The margaritas are just okay. They are fun with the beer in it but a bit too sweet for my tastes! Still 5* for the fun atmosphere and tacos!

data.title: We love fuzzys!
data.text: This place is awesome! Salads and tacos are great but I always get the nachos! They are absolutely HUGE so bring a friend. And that garlic sauce.....you'll want to get extra!

data.title: interesting place
data.text: food was pretty good---- not authentic. usually crowded and very noisy, not a place to visit with people.

data.title: Average Mexican food but with some caveats
data.text:
When we arrived to order some sit-down food the first thing that hit us was the loud music and the overall loud ambience of the place due to how it's constructed. Normally when I go to eat with someone else, sure the food is important, but how about being able to actually talk with each other without saying "huh?" every other word due to the "noise" level. Waiting in line moved along reasonably, but even the cashier kept saying "excuse me?" because she too couldn't hear me over the noise level. It went both ways since I couldn't hear her very well either. 

I got a shredded beef burrito and paid the extra money for smothering it with green chili. They take your name and you can sit where you want while waiting for your name to be called. There's one problem though - the noise is very loud and when they call your name the music briefly stops for the PA announcement for whose food is up next. This means that to hear your name being called easily, you need to stand in the area close to where they call out your name. 

I went to the table to eat with my friend and he had gotten tacos that were rather small in my opinion although he said he liked them OK. My burrito was nothing special really and the green chili was a waste of money since there was no heat at all in the green chili sauce. The meat was just OK, and there was plenty of food, but it was really very plain. It didn't taste like any Mexican food I've eaten before, perhaps a notch down from Chipotles when it comes to being anything close to average bland Mexican food. 

When I was in line I asked the lady behind the counter whether they could lower the music down because it was LOUD and she said no. If they did that then no one could hear their name being called. Perhaps they should lower the music and invest in a good PA system but then they would still need to address the acoustics of the place since that's the root cause for the loudness. 

I found it too noisy, not friendly for talking with companions, food that at best tasted average to someone that has a lot of experience eating varieties of Mexican food throughout the country. I'm not hard of hearing or have a Superman sense of hearing, it's just that we go to a restaurant to eat and talk and this restaurant is not about that. Our impression was that it's about the loud music - kind of like Texas Roadhouse.

data.title: Cant go wrong with Fuzzies
data.text:
I love fuzzy , cant go wrong their fish tacos and big Margarita.
their Nachos can feed 3 hungry people hahahaha
Excellent location in Arvada Olde town,  
I recommend trying their patio

data.title: Delicious food
data.text: Everything is great.  Parking isn't super plentiful,  but usually easy enough to find, mostly street parking.

data.title: Good but needs a little explanation
data.text:
So I am not huge on Mexican food but family and friends were going after a sporting event.  I arrived later after they had all ordered.  The way it works is you line up to order, Paul and then they call your name.  I ordered two tacos, fish and prawn.

The people taking the order were totally polite and efficient.  I did not have to wait too long for them to call my name, although I did have a problem hearing the call names.  The big surprise was that the tacos were TINY and there was the tiniest dash of prawns or fish.  Mostly lettuce.  They did taste pretty good as prawn of fish flavoured.

The ambience is very " fast food"; not significantly different than a mcdonalds or any other fast food.

They do have a good selection of beers and it is a good place for a family with kids, otherwise, I am sure you can do better in Arvada both on quality and price

data.title: Just okay.
data.text: I thought it was pricey for what you received.  And it was really quite mediocre.  Nothing great. The atmosphere was okay and would be fun with a group of people.

data.title: A nice change..especially in Aravda
data.text: A taco joint. Noisy, pretty good food, not too expensive. A pain to park. Not a big fan of the fish tacos - fish is shredded.
